ground_truth: Flynn is drinking rum down below and hides the bottle behind a Bible before standing sheepishly with his hands in his pockets. She looks at a loss and downs her tea cup of rum in a gulp. A herd of horses has been rounded up and thunders past the house. Sarah looks out the door in amazement and stares straight into the eyes of the Drover, who is galloping alongside the herd. Flynn laughs in delight, and Nullah leaps for joy. Sarah runs along the verandah watching the spectacle. Drover reins his horse in, stares at Sarah, and takes off again as the horses are all rounded up. She runs indignantly after him, gets off her knees, and looks him in the eye. He considers the sleek black thoroughbred leaping in its enclosure, eyes her, and walks off. She's dressed for the English countryside and trots off in a huff as they start to ride around the cattle, moving them into a single herd. She gallops after the lone steer. Back at the house, her luggage is being packed. The sun beats down on the homestead, and the windmill turns slowly as Nullah and Daisy carry items of luggage for Sarah. A truck approaches, which Nullah spots, and his eyes widen. Nullah frantically climbs to the water tank as Sing Song grabs the dropped bags, and Sarah watches from indoors while Daisy climbs with her son, staying around the back of the tank hidden from the truck. Daisy is about to get in with the boy but has to duck down and stay on the ladder to avoid being seen as the truck halts. Sarah pulls back the curtain and looks out at the cops. As the men look the other way, Daisy hurriedly climbs in after Nullah. She takes the tea tray to her as one man walks slowly towards the tank. Daisy clings in fear to the ladder inside the tank as the cop turns the water on in the pump, and more water floods in the tank. Daisy holds her hand up for Nullah to grab. Tracker crouches, while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the ladder, which then collapses, and they fall into the water. Daisy lifts Nullah to grab onto a pipe, and she gets a grip too, but the bar breaks, and more water floods in. The sergeant looks out at the water tower, while the Aboriginal tracker looks up and sees water pouring out of holes at the top of the tower, and more continues to pour from the tower. Daisy puts her hand over Nullah's mouth as the tracker walks slowly away and the windmill turns faster. Daisy flounders and sinks beneath the surface.

As the men look away, Daisy climbs in after Nullah. One man approaches the tank, and Daisy clings fearfully to the ladder inside as the cop turns on the pump, flooding more water in. test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Flynn drinks rum, hides the bottle behind a Bible, and stands sheepishly. She downs her rum tea. Horses thunder past the house, and Sarah watches in amazement. She locks eyes with the Drover, who gallops by and rides off. Indignant, she runs after him, eyeing the sleek black thoroughbred. Dressed for the English countryside, she chases a lone steer as cattle are herded. At the house, Nullah and Daisy pack Sarah's luggage. A truck approaches; Nullah as Daisy hides with him at the water tank. Sarah watches the cops as Daisy climbs in with Nullah. Daisy clings to the ladder as water floods in. Tracker crouches, and Daisy and Nullah fall into the water. Daisy lifts Nullah to a pipe that breaks, pouring more water in. Daisy covers Nullah's mouth as the tracker walks away and the windmill speeds up. Daisy sinks beneath the water.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Flynn, situated down below in a dimly lit corner, is sipping on rum and, with a quick, furtive glance around, he discreetly hides the nearly empty bottle behind a well-worn, leather-bound Bible. Sheepishly, he stands with his hands nonchalantly shoved into his pockets. Nearby, she appears momentarily at a loss, and in one swift motion, she downs the entire content of her teacup filled with rum in a single gulp, as if steeling herself. Outside, a herd of horses, having been expertly rounded up, thunders past the house, their hooves resonating like distant, rolling thunder. Sarah, captivated by the unexpected spectacle, peers out the door with wide-eyed amazement and locks eyes with the Drover, who is galloping majestically alongside the spirited herd. Flynn laughs heartily, caught up in delight, while Nullah leaps for joy, his excitement palpable. Sarah runs swiftly along the length of the verandah, her eyes fixed on the breathtaking spectacle unfolding before her. The Drover skillfully reins his horse in, gazes intently at Sarah, and with a swift motion, takes off again as the horses are effectively rounded up. She, driven by a mix of determination and indignation, runs after him, rises from her knees, and boldly meets his gaze. He takes a moment to consider the sleek black thoroughbred energetically leaping in its enclosure, then shifts his penetrating gaze back to her before walking away. She, dressed in attire more suited for the tranquil English countryside, trots off in a huff, following after as they begin to ride around the cattle, expertly moving them into a unified herd. Determined, she gallops after a solitary steer that has strayed. Back at the house, preparations are underway as her luggage is being meticulously packed. The relentless sun beats down mercilessly on the homestead, and the windmill turns languidly in the gentle breeze as Nullah and Daisy diligently carry items of luggage intended for Sarah. As a truck approaches in the distance, and Nullah's eyes widen with a mix of curiosity and apprehension, he hurriedly climbs up the water tank, while Sing Song swiftly grabs the bags that have been dropped. Meanwhile, Sarah watches intently from indoors, and Daisy climbs with her son, carefully staying concealed around the back of the tank, hidden from the view of those in the approaching truck. Just as Daisy is about to climb into the tank with the boy, she is forced to duck down and remain poised on the ladder to avoid detection as the truck comes to a sudden halt. Sarah gently pulls back the curtain and peers out at the sight of the cops. As the men momentarily avert their gaze, Daisy seizes the chance to quickly climb in after Nullah. She takes hold of the tea tray and offers it to her as one man begins walking deliberately towards the tank. Inside, Daisy clings desperately to the ladder within the tank, gripped by fear, as the cop turns on the water pump, causing more water to rapidly flood into the tank. As Daisy reaches her hand up for Nullah to grab, Tracker crouches stealthily, while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the unstable ladder, which suddenly collapses, plunging them into the churning water. Daisy, with a swift, decisive move, lifts Nullah, urging him to grab onto a nearby pipe, and she manages to secure a grip as well. However, the bar breaks under the strain, and even more water rushes in, cascading relentlessly. The sergeant stands, observing the water tower, while the Aboriginal tracker gazes upwards, noticing water pouring from holes at the top of the tower and continuing in a torrent. In a tense, pivotal moment, Daisy places her hand over Nullah's mouth to silence him as the tracker slowly walks away, and the windmill turns with increasing speed. Daisy struggles against the rising tide and ultimately sinks beneath the surface.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Flynn, positioned down in a dimly lit corner of the room, sits sipping on rum. With a quick, furtive glance surveying his surroundings, he discreetly conceals the nearly empty bottle behind a well-worn, leather-bound Bible that shows the signs of many years of use. Rising sheepishly to his feet, he stands with his hands nonchalantly shoved into his pockets, attempting to appear casual. Nearby, she seems momentarily at a loss for what to do, and in one swift and decisive motion, she downs the entire contents of her teacup, which is brimming with rum, in a single, confident gulp, as if she is steeling herself for what lies ahead. Outside, a herd of robust horses, expertly rounded up, thunders past the house, their powerful hooves resonating like distant, rolling thunder echoing through the air. Sarah, completely captivated by the unexpected spectacle, peers out the door with wide-eyed amazement, her gaze locking onto the Drover, who is galloping majestically alongside the spirited herd. Flynn laughs heartily, caught up in the delight of the moment, while Nullah leaps for joy, his uncontainable excitement palpable to all around. Sarah runs swiftly along the length of the verandah, her eyes intently fixed on the breathtaking spectacle unfolding before her. The Drover, demonstrating remarkable skill, reins his horse in, gazes intently at Sarah, and with a swift and determined motion, takes off again as the horses are effectively rounded up. Driven by a potent mix of determination and indignation, she runs after him, rising from her knees to boldly meet his gaze. He takes a moment to consider the sleek black thoroughbred energetically leaping within its enclosure, then shifts his penetrating gaze back to her before turning away and walking off. She, dressed in attire that seems better suited for the tranquil English countryside, trots off in a huff, determinedly following after him as they begin to ride around the cattle, expertly guiding them into a unified herd. With determination, she gallops after a solitary steer that has strayed from the group. Back at the house, preparations are underway, with her luggage being meticulously packed. The relentless sun beats down with unyielding intensity on the homestead, and the creaky windmill turns languidly in response to the gentle breeze as Nullah and Daisy diligently carry various items of luggage intended for Sarah. As a truck approaches in the distance, Nullah's eyes widen with a mix of curiosity and apprehension, prompting him to hurriedly climb up the water tank, while Sing Song swiftly grabs hold of the bags that have been dropped. Meanwhile, Sarah watches intently from indoors, and Daisy climbs with her son, carefully staying concealed around the back of the tank, hidden from the view of those in the approaching truck. Just as Daisy is about to climb into the tank with the boy, she is forced to duck down and remain poised on the ladder to avoid detection as the truck comes to a sudden halt nearby. Sarah gently pulls back the curtain and peers out with caution at the sight of the cops. As the men momentarily avert their gaze, Daisy seizes the chance to quickly climb in after Nullah. She takes hold of the tea tray and offers it to her as one man begins walking deliberately toward the tank. Inside, Daisy clings desperately to the ladder within the tank, gripped by fear and anxiety, as the cop turns on the water pump, causing more water to rapidly flood into the tank, increasing her peril. As Daisy reaches her hand up for Nullah to grab, Tracker crouches stealthily nearby, while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the unstable ladder, which suddenly gives way and collapses, plunging them into the churning water below. Daisy, with a swift and decisive move, lifts Nullah, urging him to grab onto a nearby pipe, and she manages to secure a grip as well. However, the bar breaks under the strain, and even more water rushes in, cascading relentlessly into the tank. The sergeant stands, observing the water tower intently, while the Aboriginal tracker gazes upwards, noticing the water pouring incessantly from holes at the top of the tower and continuing in a torrential stream. In a tense, pivotal moment, Daisy places her hand over Nullah's mouth to silence him as the tracker slowly walks away, and the windmill begins to turn with increasing speed. Daisy struggles valiantly against the rising tide of water and ultimately sinks beneath the surface, engulfed by the relentless flood.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Flynn takes a moment to indulge in a drink of rum hidden in the privacy of the below-deck area, carefully placing the bottle behind a Bible to conceal his indulgence. He then stands up with a hint of embarrassment, tucking his hands into his pockets as he takes in the scene. Meanwhile, she appears overwhelmed by the situation, quickly lifting her tea cup filled with rum to her lips and consuming the entire contents in one swift gulp. Outside, a dramatic event unfolds as a herd of horses, having been successfully rounded up, thunders past the house with great momentum. Sarah, caught by surprise, directs her gaze out the door and is captivated by the sight, locking eyes with the Drover, who is skillfully galloping alongside the herd. Flynn, observing the commotion, lets out a laugh of pure delight, while Nullah jumps up with exuberance, unable to contain his joy. In response to the exhilarating scene, Sarah dashes along the verandah to get a better view of the ongoing spectacle. The Drover, having managed to control his horse, reins it in and casts a lingering stare at Sarah, only to swiftly take off again once the horses are under control. Driven by a mix of emotion, Sarah chases indignantly after him, determined to confront the situation, and rises from her knees to meet his gaze directly. Meanwhile, the Drover evaluates a sleek black thoroughbred, bounding energetically in its enclosure, glancing back at her before deciding to walk away. Sarah, clad in attire suited for the English countryside, strides off in a fit of huffiness as the cattle herders begin the process of rounding the cattle into a single herd. Taking on a determined air, she jumps onto her horse and gallops in pursuit of a lone steer that has strayed from the herd. Back at the homestead, preparations are underway for her departure, with her luggage being carefully packed. The sun casts its relentless rays over the property, and the windmill creaks as it turns slowly in the breeze. Nullah and Daisy dutifully carry Sarah's luggage, ensuring everything is in order. Their attention is suddenly diverted as they spot an approaching truck, causing Nullah's eyes to widen with recognition and urgency. Reacting quickly, Nullah scrambles up the water tank, while Sing Song hurriedly retrieves the recently dropped bags. Inside the house, Sarah looks on, her gaze following Daisy as she climbs with her son, ensuring they remain hidden from view at the back of the tank as the truck comes to a halt nearby. Daisy, on the verge of entering the tank with her boy, is forced to crouch low, clinging to the ladder to evade detection as the truck's occupants step out. From her position, Sarah discreetly pulls back the curtain, peering out cautiously at the police officers. Seizing a moment when the officers' attention is diverted, Daisy hastily climbs inside to join Nullah, while Sarah hastily brings the tea tray to her. As one of the men leisurely approaches the tank, Daisy's grip tightens in fear on the ladder. At this moment, the officer activates the water pump, sending a rush of water to flood into the tank. In the chaos, Daisy reaches up, urging Nullah to grab hold of her hand for safety. As the tracker crouches below, Daisy and Nullah cling desperately to the precarious ladder, which then collapses, plunging them both into the water. Quick to act, Daisy hoists Nullah upward, urging him to latch onto a protruding pipe, and secures her own grip there. However, disaster strikes as the bar supporting them snaps, releasing more water into the already flooded tank. Meanwhile, the sergeant casts his gaze towards the water tower, and the Aboriginal tracker notices the telltale signs of water spilling from holes at the top of the structure, with a steady gush continuing to issue forth. In a desperate bid to stay hidden, Daisy covers Nullah's mouth with her hand as the tracker moves away, oblivious to their presence. Meanwhile, the windmill intensifies its speed, matching the rising tension of the moment. Battling the surging waters, Daisy struggles to maintain her position, but ultimately loses her grip and sinks beneath the surface, disappearing into the depths of the tank.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Flynn hides his rum behind a Bible and stands sheepishly, while she downs her rum in one gulp. A herd of horses thunders past, and Sarah, amazed, watches the Drover gallop alongside. Flynn and Nullah express delight, and Sarah runs along the verandah, captivated. Drover reins in his horse, stares at Sarah, and rides off as the horses are rounded up. She indignantly confronts him, but he leaves her behind as they begin herding cattle. Dressed in English attire, Sarah gallops after a steer. Back at the homestead, her luggage is being packed under the scorching sun, while Nullah and Daisy carry her items. A truck approaches, causing Nullah to climb the water tank in alarm. Daisy and Nullah hide behind the tank as Sarah observes from inside. Daisy stays hidden on the ladder as a cop nears, then climbs in after Nullah as Sarah distracts them. The cop turns on the pump, flooding the tank, and Daisy holds Nullah up as they cling to a ladder. The ladder collapses, sending them into the water. As water pours out, Daisy covers Nullah's mouth to muffle sounds while the tracker walks away. Daisy struggles and sinks beneath the surface as the windmill spins faster.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Flynn, who is known for his penchant for mischief, is drinking rum down below and hides the bottle behind a Bible, an item often kept for divine guidance, before standing sheepishly with his hands in his pockets. She, looking at a loss as if uncertain of what to do, downs her tea cup of rum in a gulp. A herd of horses, likely mustangs that are common in the Australian outback, has been rounded up and thunders past the house. Sarah looks out the door in amazement, not used to such spectacles, and stares straight into the eyes of the Drover, a skilled stockman often seen managing large herds, who is galloping alongside the herd. Flynn laughs in delight at the unfolding scene, and Nullah, who is a young Aboriginal boy with a deep connection to the land, leaps for joy. Sarah runs along the verandah, a roofed platform typical of Australian houses, watching the spectacle. Drover reins his horse in, stares at Sarah in a way that suggests a silent acknowledgment, and takes off again as the horses are all rounded up. She runs indignantly after him, gets off her knees, and looks him in the eye, determined to make her point understood. He considers the sleek black thoroughbred, an agile and prized breed leaping in its enclosure, eyes her with a contemplative look, and walks off. She's dressed for the English countryside, an attire suitable for cooler climates but ill-suited for the harsh Australian sun, and trots off in a huff as they start to ride around the cattle, moving them into a single herd. She gallops after the lone steer, determined to prove her capability. Back at the house, her luggage, filled with belongings from her life in England, is being packed. The sun beats down mercilessly on the homestead, a remote farmhouse, and the windmill, an essential feature for pumping water, turns slowly as Nullah and Daisy carry items of luggage for Sarah. A truck, a rare sight in these parts which indicates visitors or officials, approaches, which Nullah spots, and his eyes widen with concern. Nullah frantically climbs to the water tank, a reservoir for essential water storage, as Sing Song, a friend and ally in their escapade, grabs the dropped bags, and Sarah watches from indoors while Daisy climbs with her son, staying around the back of the tank hidden from the truck. Daisy, who is protective and resourceful, is about to get in with the boy but has to duck down and stay on the ladder to avoid being seen as the truck halts. Sarah pulls back the curtain and looks out at the cops, who are likely known for enforcing strict local laws. As the men look the other way, Daisy hurriedly climbs in after Nullah. She takes the tea tray, a symbol of British decorum, to her as one man walks slowly towards the tank. Daisy clings in fear to the ladder inside the tank as the cop, a figure of authority, turns the water on in the pump, and more water floods in the tank. Daisy holds her hand up for Nullah to grab, showing her determination to protect him. Tracker crouches, while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the ladder, which then collapses, sending them into the water. Daisy lifts Nullah to grab onto a pipe, a vital structure for stability in the tank, and she gets a grip too, but the bar breaks, creating a sense of urgency as more water floods in. The sergeant, an officer in charge, looks out at the water tower, while the Aboriginal tracker, skilled in following signs unseen by others, looks up and sees water pouring out of holes at the top of the tower, and more continues to pour from the tower. Daisy puts her hand over Nullah's mouth, silencing him to prevent detection, as the tracker walks slowly away and the windmill turns faster, driven by the gathering storm. Daisy flounders, struggling to maintain her grip, and sinks beneath the surface, consumed by the rising water.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Flynn is drinking rum down below and hides the bottle behind a Bible before standing sheepishly with his hands in his pockets. She looks at a loss and downs her tea cup of rum in a gulp. A herd of horses has been rounded up and thunders past the house. Sarah looks out the door in amazement and stares straight into the eyes of the Drover who is galloping alongside the herd. Flynn laughs in delight and Nullah leaps for joy. Sarah runs along the verandah watching the spectacle. Drover reins his horse in stares at Sarah and takes off again as the horses are all rounded up. She runs indignantly after him gets off her knees and looks him in the eye. He considers the sleek black thoroughbred leaping in its enclosure eyes her and walks off. She is dressed for the English countryside and trots off in a huff as they start to ride around the cattle moving them into a single herd. She gallops after the lone steer. Back at the house her luggage is being packed. The sun beats down on the homestead and the windmill turns slowly as Nullah and Daisy carry items of luggage for Sarah. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. A truck approaches which Nullah spots and his eyes widen. Nullah frantically climbs to the water tank as Sing Song grabs the dropped bags and Sarah watches from indoors while Daisy climbs with her son staying around the back of the tank hidden from the truck. Daisy is about to get in with the boy but has to duck down and stay on the ladder to avoid being seen as the truck halts. Sarah pulls back the curtain and looks out at the cops. As the men look the other way Daisy hurriedly climbs in after Nullah. She takes the tea tray to her as one man walks slowly towards the tank. Daisy clings in fear to the ladder inside the tank as the cop turns the water on in the pump and more water floods in the tank. Daisy holds her hand up for Nullah to grab. Tracker crouches while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the ladder which then collapses and they fall into the water. Daisy lifts Nullah to grab onto a pipe and she gets a grip too but the bar breaks and more water floods in. The sergeant looks out at the water tower while the Aboriginal tracker looks up and sees water pouring out of holes at the top of the tower and more continues to pour from the tower. Daisy puts her hand over Nullah's mouth as the tracker walks slowly away and the windmill turns faster. Daisy flounders and sinks beneath the surface.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Flynn is tossing rum down below and conceals the bottle behind a Bible before standing reluctantly with his hands in his pockets. She appears bewildered and hurls her tea cup of rum at the wall. A herd of horses has been summoned and charges past the house. Sarah peers out the door in astonishment and glances straight into the eyes of the Drover, who is darting alongside the herd. Flynn chuckles in amusement, and Nullah hops with glee. Sarah skips along the verandah observing the spectacle. Drover halts his horse, gazes at Sarah, and gallops away as the horses are all corralled. She shuffles indignantly after him, gets off her knees, and gazes him in the eye. He assesses the sleek black thoroughbred prancing in its enclosure, observes her, and strolls off. She's dressed for the English countryside and stomps off in a huff as they begin to prance around the cattle, nudging them into a single herd. She trots after the lone steer. Back at the house, her luggage is being loaded. The sun blazes down on the homestead, and the windmill spins slowly as Nullah and Daisy transport items of luggage for Sarah. A truck advances, which Nullah notices, and his eyes widen. Nullah quickly scurries to the water tank as Sing Song collects the dropped bags, and Sarah watches from indoors while Daisy ascends with her son, staying around the back of the tank concealed from the truck. Daisy is about to clamber in with the boy but has to crouch down and remain on the ladder to avoid detection as the truck stops. Sarah draws back the curtain and peers out at the cops. As the men glance the other way, Daisy swiftly climbs in after Nullah. She carries the tea tray to her as one man ambles slowly towards the tank. Daisy grips in fear to the ladder inside the tank as the cop activates the water in the pump, and more water gushes in the tank. Daisy stretches her hand up for Nullah to clutch. Tracker crouches, while Daisy and Nullah cling desperately to the ladder, which then disintegrates, and they plunge into the water. Daisy raises Nullah to cling onto a pipe, and she secures a grip too, but the bar snaps, and more water cascades in. The sergeant observes out at the water tower, while the Aboriginal tracker glances up and notices water streaming from holes at the top of the tower, and more continues to drain from the tower. Daisy places her hand over Nullah's mouth as the tracker wanders slowly away and the windmill spins faster. Daisy struggles and submerges beneath the surface.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Griffin is sipping gin above deck and hides the glass behind a dictionary before standing bashfully with his hands on his belt. He glances puzzled and downs his mug of gin in a gulp. A flock of birds has been gathered up and flutters past the barn. Lisa peers out the window in disbelief and gazes directly into the eyes of the Skipper, who is flying beside the flock. Griffin chuckles in amusement, and Benny jumps for joy. Lisa strides along the balcony observing the phenomenon. Skipper reins his eagle in, gazes at Lisa, and takes off again as the birds are all gathered up. She chases him indignantly, stands up from her seat, and meets his gaze. He considers the sleek white falcon soaring in its pen, observes her, and strolls off. She's dressed for the urban jungle and strides off in a huff as they begin to glide around the goats, moving them into a single flock. She gallops after the lone goat. Back at the barn, her boxes are being prepared. The moon beams down on the mansion, and the weathervane spins slowly as Benny and Lily carry pieces of furniture for Lisa. A car approaches, which Benny notices, and his eyes widen. Benny frantically ascends to the grain silo as Ding Ding picks up the fallen tools, and Lisa observes from inside while Lily climbs with her son, staying around the back of the silo concealed from the car. Lily is about to get in with the child but has to crouch down and remain on the ladder to prevent being noticed as the car stops. Lisa pulls back the blinds and peeks out at the guards. As the drivers look the opposite way, Lily quickly climbs in after Benny. She carries the coffee table to her as one driver ambles leisurely towards the silo. Lily clutches in terror to the ladder inside the silo as the guard turns the crank on the pump, and more grain floods in the silo. Lily extends her hand for Benny to grasp. Detective crouches, while Lily and Benny cling desperately to the ladder, which then collapses, and they tumble into the grain. Lily hoists Benny to grasp onto a beam, and she gets a hold too, but the beam snaps, and more grain pours in. The constable glances out at the grain silo, while the local tracker glances up and notices grain streaming out of cracks at the top of the silo, and more continues to stream from the silo. Lily places her hand over Benny's mouth as the tracker strolls leisurely away and the weathervane spins faster. Lily struggles and submerges beneath the grains.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption

A pride of lions has been gathered and paces past the bakery. Mark peers out the window in confusion and gazes directly into the eyes of the Butler, who is jogging alongside the pride. Gwen giggles with amusement, and Monty hops with excitement. Mark strolls along the sidewalk observing the scene. Butler halts his bike, glares at Mark, and pedals off again as the lions are all gathered together. He strolls nonchalantly after him, stands on his tiptoes, and glances him in the eye. She observes the sleek white sports car idling in its garage, glares at him, and struts away. He's dressed for the Sahara Desert and saunters off in a huff as they start to drive around the alpacas, corralling them into one group. He cycles after the stray alpaca. Back at the bakery, his belongings are being loaded. The clouds drift overhead the building, and the clock ticks slowly as Monty and Lily lift items of luggage for Mark. Monty swiftly climbs to the observation deck as Echo retrieves the scattered papers, and Mark watches from outside while Lily climbs with her daughter, staying behind the deck shielded from the cab. As the women glance the other way, Lily quickly climbs in after Monty. She hands the coffee cup to him as one woman strolls silently towards the deck. Lily grips tightly to the rail inside the deck as the chef turns the tap on in the fountain, and more cola gushes in the deck. Lily reaches her hand up for Monty to hold. Lookout kneels, while Lily and Monty cling desperately to the rail, which then snaps, and they plunge into the cola. Lily hoists Monty to seize onto a beam, and she hangs on too, but the latch crackles, and more cola gushes in. The cook gazes out at the fountain view, while the Native lookout glances up and observes soda trickling out of fissures at the top of the fountain, and more continues to spill from the fountain. Lily clamps her hand over Monty’s mouth as the lookout strolls tranquilly away and the clock ticks faster. Lily struggles and vanishes beneath the fizz.

He appears puzzled and gulps his mug of lemonade in one swallow. A pack of wolves has been herded and races past the barn. Linda peeks through the window in shock and gazes directly into the eyes of the Juggler, who is sprinting alongside the pack. Hank chuckles in satisfaction, and Milo dances with excitement. Linda skips along the terrace observing the wonder. Juggler tugs his camel to a halt, glances at Linda, and bolts off once more as the wolves are all herded. He dashes defiantly after her, springs off his toes, and locks eyes with her. She examines the nimble white stallion jumping in its pen, assesses him, and strides away. He's dressed for the Arctic wilderness and trudges off in a huff as they begin to parade around the sheep, gathering them into a solitary flock. He trots after the solitary goat. Back at the barn, his crates are being unpacked. The rain pours over the cabin, and the weathervane spins rapidly as Milo and Rose haul pieces of furniture for Linda. A bicycle approaches, which Milo notices, and his jaw drops. Milo quickly scales the grain silo as Bell Song snatches the forgotten parcels, and Linda observes from outdoors while Rose climbs with her daughter, remaining behind the shed concealed from the bicycle. Rose is about to join the girl but has to crouch low and remain on the stairs to avoid being spotted as the bicycle halts. Linda adjusts the blinds and peers out at the guards. As the women look away, Rose swiftly clambers in after Milo. He offers the beverage tray to her as one woman strides slowly towards the silo. Rose grips tightly to the steps inside the silo as the guard switches on the faucet, and more liquid pours into the silo. Rose reaches out for Milo to clutch. Scout kneels, while Rose and Milo grip desperately to the steps, which then crumble, and they tumble into the liquid. Rose elevates Milo to hold onto a beam, and she catches hold too, but the plank snaps, and more liquid cascades in. The captain peers towards the grain silo, while the Native scout gazes up and observes water gushing from cracks at the tip of the silo, and more streams from the silo. Rose places her finger over Milo's lips as the scout saunters away and the weathervane spins harder. Rose flails and submerges below the surface.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Flynn sheepishly hides his rum bottle and Sarah gulps down tea with rum. A herd of horses passes by, and Sarah locks eyes with the Drover. Excited, she runs after the spectacle. Drover reins in, stares at Sarah, then rides off. Sarah, dressed for the English countryside, follows in a huff as they herd cattle. At the homestead, Sarah's luggage is being packed while Nullah spots an approaching truck. He climbs the water tank with Daisy to hide. As a cop nears the tank, Daisy clings fearfully to the ladder. Suddenly, the ladder collapses, and they fall into the water. Daisy tries to keep Nullah afloat, but as more water floods in, they struggle. The sergeant observes the water tower while the Aboriginal tracker notices water pouring out. Daisy flounders and eventually sinks beneath the surface.

past the house As the men look the other way Daisy hurriedly climbs in after Nullah Daisy puts her hand over Nullah's mouth as the tracker walks slowly away and the windmill turns faster Flynn laughs in delight and Nullah leaps for joy Tracker crouches while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the ladder which then collapses and they fall into the water She runs indignantly after him gets off her knees and looks him in the eye He considers the sleek black thoroughbred leaping in its enclosure eyes her and walks off Flynn is drinking rum down below and hides the bottle behind a Bible before standing sheepishly with his hands in his pockets Sarah looks out the door in amazement and stares straight into the eyes of the Drover who is galloping alongside the herd Daisy holds her hand up for Nullah to grab

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: A truck approaches which Nullah spots and his eyes widen Nullah frantically climbs to the water tank as Sing Song grabs the dropped bags and Sarah watches from indoors while Daisy climbs with her son staying around the back of the tank hidden from the truck Daisy is about to get in with the boy but has to duck down and stay on the ladder to avoid being seen as the truck halts Sarah pulls back the curtain and looks out at the cops As the men look the other way Daisy hurriedly climbs in after Nullah She takes the tea tray to her as one man walks slowly towards the tank Daisy clings in fear to the ladder inside the tank as the cop turns the water on in the pump and more water floods in the tank Daisy holds her hand up for Nullah to grab Tracker crouches while Daisy and Nullah cling frantically to the ladder which then collapses and they fall into the water Daisy lifts Nullah to grab onto a pipe and she gets a grip too but the bar breaks and more water floods in The sergeant looks out at the water tower while the Aboriginal tracker looks up and sees water pouring out of holes at the top of the tower and more continues to pour from the tower Daisy puts her hand over Nullah's mouth as the tracker walks slowly away and the windmill turns faster Daisy flounders and sinks beneath the surface Flynn is drinking rum down below and hides the bottle behind a Bible before standing sheepishly with his hands in his pockets She looks at a loss and downs her tea cup of rum in a gulp A herd of horses has been rounded up and thunders past the house Sarah looks out the door in amazement and stares straight into the eyes of the Drover who is galloping alongside the herd Flynn laughs in delight and Nullah leaps for joy Sarah runs along the verandah watching the spectacle Drover reins his horse in stares at Sarah and takes off again as the horses are all rounded up She runs indignantly after him gets off her knees and looks him in the eye He considers the sleek black thoroughbred leaping in its enclosure eyes her and walks off She is dressed for the English countryside and trots off in a huff as they start to ride around the cattle moving them into a single herd She gallops after the lone steer Back at the house her luggage is being packed The sun beats down on the homestead and the windmill turns slowly as Nullah and Daisy carry items of luggage for Sarah
